text: single-particle cryo-electron microscopy
or cryo am is an advancing technology
that is bringing key molecules into
focus here's how it works first the
molecules are suspended in a solution
then the solution is placed onto a fine
mesh screen called a grid the grid is
blotted to remove excess liquid and so
that the molecules are spread out in a
single layer to stop the movement of the
molecules and protect them during
imaging the grid is quickly cooled to
around minus 200 degrees Celsius next
the grid is loaded into a cassette and
put under the scope these molecules are
too small to be seen with visible light
instead electrons are used to visualize
them images of thousands of identical
molecules viewed at different
orientations are compiled into a highly
detailed molecular map as the techniques
and technology improve cryo-em
could be helpful in understanding the
basic molecules of the body and
designing drugs to treat disease
[Music]
